headline: CrowdStrike: Higher Sales, Higher Costs
summary: CrowdStrike topped Wall Street earnings expectations, but adjusted EPS, free cash flow, and net new recurring revenue all were lower than Q1 2025.  CrowdStrike's "FalconFlex" licensing program is proving popular with customers.  Coming up on the one-year anniversary of CrowdStrike's disastrous July 2024 global outage, the cybersecurity company continues to make progress moving past the incident.

headline: CrowdStrike Holdings (NasdaqGS:CRWD) Enhances Security With Portnox Integration For Zero Trust Solutions
summary: CrowdStrike Holdings (NasdaqGS:CRWD) showcased a notable price increase of 32%, aligning with several positive developments that unfolded over the last quarter. Key among them was the strategic partnership with Portnox, integrating CrowdStrike's cybersecurity solutions to enhance network access control, alongside collaborations with Microsoft and AARNet, which strengthened their offerings. An expanded partnership with ExtraHop further bolstered visibility into AI risks. Meanwhile, the market...

headline: CrowdStrike Posts Strong EPS, Weak Revenue Guide -- Stock Plunges After The News
summary: A blowout earnings beat wasn't enough to offset soft Q2 revenue guidance. Investors reacted fast--then started buying the dip.

headline: Morning Movers: Chart Industries, Flowserve both rise following merger pact
summary: Stock market futures are slightly lower this morning as investors digest a mix of tariff and jobs concerns. Traders are focused on the labor market this week, with jobless claims and the May employment report on the horizon. After ADP announced private payrolls increased a lean 37,000 in May, President Trump repeated his view that the Fed “must” lower rates “now.” Meanwhile, concern about the impact of tariffs have been stoked again following a warning from Dollar Tree about profit pressure rela

headline: CrowdStrike price target raised to $500 from $405 at BMO Capital
summary: BMO Capital raised the firm’s price target on CrowdStrike (CRWD) to $500 from $405 and keeps an Outperform rating on the shares. The company reported a “solid if unspectacular” quarterly report, and the firm continues to think that CrowdStrike has one of the most comprehensive and effective security portfolios, the analyst tells investors in a research note. CrowdStrike should be able to sustain 20% type top-line growth into FY27 as its execution remains solid from an R&D and go-to-market perspe

headline: 2 Potential Stock-Split Stocks Up 185% and 255% in 3 Years to Buy Now, According to Certain Wall Street Analysts
summary: Meta Platforms and CrowdStrike are stock-split candidates in 2025 after experiencing tremendous share price appreciation during the last three years.  Meta Platforms is the second-largest adtech company in the world, and it’s developing artificial intelligence (AI) tools to automate the ad creation process.  CrowdStrike is a leader in several cybersecurity software verticals, and the company is investing in go-to market capabilities and internal automation.
